metadata.name: Suspicious Service DACL Modification Via Set-Service Cmdlet
metadata.comment: Detects suspicious DACL modifications via the "Set-Service" cmdlet using the "SecurityDescriptorSddl" flag (Only available with PowerShell 7) that can be used to hide services or make them unstopable

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\pwsh.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('pwsh.dll') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-securitydescriptorsddl ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-sd '))) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('set-service ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('d;;')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(';;;iu')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(';;;su')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(';;;ba')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(';;;sy')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(';;;wd'))))

output.summary: Detects suspicious DACL modifications via the "Set-Service" cmdlet using the "SecurityDescriptorSddl" flag (Only available with PowerShell 7) that can be used to hide services or make them unstopable
